The Daily Caller reports Rep. Mike Pence ( R-IN), a possible contender for president in 2012, has announced that he will NOT run for the White House: As reported by the Indianapolis Star, Mike Pence has circulated a letter to supporters announcing the decision. "In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana," wrote Mike Pence . "We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012."

the Egyptian Museum, which was hit during anti-government protests on January 28. Antiquities Minister Zahi Hawass says looters escaped with several items, including two gilded wooden statues of Tutankhamen and approximately 16 other valuable artifacts. , 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. It said the management changes would take effect on April 4.
